release.action: Fixed Issue 57: Support setting string values with binary content.
Fixed Issue 48: Conversion errors with floats and doubles.
Fixed issue 50: Remove systematic final attributes on methods.
Fixed issue 51: Remove static attribute on commons logging logger.
Fixed issue 44: Marshaler should initialize all items of a fixed sized complex array when the bound value object is empty of partially filled.
Added XML to Host transformers based on reflection.
Removed byteLength from the expected java annotations. The calculation is done at generation time.
Added support for Transformers and the new associated API.
Fixed Issue 29: When mainframe sends partial data, converters should produce default values or use the partial data when it is available.

Fixing Issue 28: COBOL Binding class does not compile for arrays with OCCURS 0 TO 1. The case OCCURS 0 TO 1 DEPENDING ON is now managed as an optional element (not an array). The counter element in DEPENDING ON will be set to 1 if object exist and conversely, host data is assumed to contain bytes for that element if the associated counter is 1.
Fixed Bug 30: String padding character now depends on target host character set rather than being hardcoded as 0x40.

Fixed Bug 31: Zoned decimals are now considered as characters and are translated to the target host character set. This opens the possibility that the target character set be ASCII rather than EBCDIC. An important restriction is that COBOL decimals must be unsigned or explicitly declared with SIGN IS SEPARATE if the target character set is not EBCDIC.
Changed code due to removal of "Type" as the default jaxbTypeClassesSuffix in XML schema generation. JAXB test class names are not suffixed with "Type" anymore.
It is now possible to bind directly to a POJO rather than a JAXB class. The JAXB classes are still needed at generation time but not at runtime anymore.
Package "com.legstar.host" has been renamed "com.legstar.coxb.host" and moved to the coxbapi project.
Visitor classes have been moved from package "com.legstar.host" to "com.legstar.coxb.visitor".
Package "com.legstar.coxb.rt" has been removed. Classes in "com.legstar.coxb.impl" provide runtime functionalities.
Binding classes now implement a "calcByteLength" method to evaluate the maximum host data buffer length needed for marshaling. The "getByteLength" method now returns zero for group items.

Binding classes now have a constructor which takes the JAXB object as its sole argument. The constructors that used to take the JAXB object factory as a parameter have been removed (the binding class has a private property pointing to this object factory now).
Binding classes do not have a "getJaxbObject" anymore. Instead, they implement a "getxxx" method where xxx is the underlying JAXB object name.
First version of the COBOL Binding Runtime.
